zone.line: shower; as my dank hair clung to
my neck and partly covered my face,
I had hardly strength to part with
my fingers, the long strait locks
that fell before my eyes. The dark
ness was much dissipated and in
the east where the clouds were
least dense the moon was
visible behind the thin grey
cloud â€“
The moon is behind, and at the full
And yet she looks both small & dull
and dull.
but Its presence gave me a hope
that by its means Imi I might
find my home. But I was languid
and many hours passed before I
could reach the cottage, dragging as
I did my l slow steps, and often
resting on the wet earth unable to
proceed.
